package.name: clamav
package.description:
Two security problems have been found and fixed in the antivirus scan engine "clamav", which could be used by remote attackers sending prepared E-Mails containing special crafted infected files to potentially execute code.
CVE-2006-4182: A problem in dealing with PE (Portable Executables aka Windows .EXE) files could result in an integer overflow, causing a heap overflow, which could be used by attackers to potentially execute code.
CVE-2006-5295: A problem in dealing with CHM (compressed helpfile) exists that could cause an invalid memory read, causing the clamav engine to crash.
